intro: Marsdenia akkar, commonly known as the Akkar Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellowish-green with a prominent central corona, and it produces follicles that contain seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Marsdenia akkar is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
